area_name: Chamber of Secrets - CLOSED TO CLIMBING!!

content.description: As you may guess this route can be found on the N by NW corner of the formation.  One can scramble up the first 40' slab to belay at a bench or climb this in 2 pitches.  Great, well protected climbing in an airy setting.
content.protection:
city of rocks rack to #3.

all natural

rap anchor SW of summit.

content.description: A beautiful line that moves under the large roof and escapes to a ramp to the right of the steep N face (shown in photo for Figure 4).
content.protection:
bring extra #2's and #3s

all natural

rap from summit
content.location: Climb straight up obvious N facing wall on the west side of this formation. See photo for 'Figure 4'.  This route and 'figure 4' are shown as 'A. nice line, good rock, unclimbed' in the photo of the Chamber of Secrets in the guidebook.

content.description: An obvious line up the weakness in the west face of this formation.  An interesting and wide move utilizing a figure 4 move on a horn forms the crux of the route.
content.location: see photo.  This line and 'iron cross' are shown as 'a. Nice line, good rock, unclimbed' in the chamber of secrets photo in the guidebook.

content.description:
Poorly protected but mostly low angle slabbing.

Added to the database for historical perspective.

Very sparse protection up rock that was sorta loose. Â Loose plates on the first pitch.

Rappel was from a black sling off the summit down the west side from a knot block in a crack.
content.protection: No fixed pro.  Very poor selection of slings, nuts and cams.
content.location: From the notch on the east side of the formation, climb obvious lower angle weaknesses.

content.description: Lots of hard climbing. Follow the nice diagonalling hand crack on the west face that starts about 60' right of 'iron cross'.  Move toward a roof just to the right of the arete and step down and join 'iron cross'.  The step across places you several feet above a blue/green alien size piece - hence the pg-13 rating.  Belay on the face to the left of the arete and get ready for the crux on 'iron cross'.
content.location: Left side of the west face just before the gully that leads to 'Figure 4'.  See photo.  This line is shown as 'B' on the Chamber of Secrets in the guidebook.

pathTokens: Chamber of Secrets - CLOSED TO CLIMBING!!
